body_html:
I found that the Session object is stored in sess._sess._sess._sess._sess and if I do

saver.save(sess._sess._sess._sess._sess, 'model.ckpt')

It actually works, but this is of course not desired. I wrote temporary method to circumvent the issue until it is solved:

def get_session(sess):
    session = sess
    while type(session).__name__ != 'Session':
        #pylint: disable=W0212
        session = session._sess
    return session

I can then save with:

saver.save(get_session(sess), 'model.ckpt')

It actually works, but this is of course not desired. I wrote temporary method to circumvent the issue until it is solved:
def get_session(sess):
    session = sess
    while type(session).__name__ != 'Session':
        #pylint: disable=W0212

    return session

body:
I found that the Session object is stored in sess._sess._sess._sess._sess and if I do 

```
saver.save(sess._sess._sess._sess._sess, 'model.ckpt')
```

It actually works, but this is of course not desired. I wrote temporary method to circumvent the issue until it is solved:

```
def get_session(sess):
    session = sess
    while type(session).__name__ != 'Session':
        #pylint: disable=W0212
        session = session._sess
    return session
```

I can then save with:

```
saver.save(get_session(sess), 'model.ckpt')
```
